text: âž¡ When was Patient Zero (the first Ugandan with Covid-19) reported in Uganda?

answer.response: Wrong. The first patent diagnosed with Covid-19 was treated at Mulago National Referral Hospital on March 22nd, 2020. Since then there have been 33,360 confirmed new cases.

text: âž¡ What are the symptoms compatible with Covid-19?

ðŸ”¸1. Fever, cough, myalgia or fatigue, shortness of breath, sore throat and headache. Other symptoms may include: flu-like symptoms, diarrhea and nausea, muscle ache, pneumonia and Acute Respiratory Distress Syndrome (ARDS), renal failure, pericarditis and Disseminated Intravascular Coagulation (DIC).

answer.response: Wrong. Fever, cough, myalgia or fatigue, shortness of breath, sore throat and headache are symptoms associated with Covid-19. Other symptoms may include: flu-like symptoms, diarrhea and nausea, muscle ache, pneumonia and Acute Respiratory Distress Syndrome (ARDS), renal failure, pericarditis and Disseminated Intravascular Coagulation (DIC).

text: âž¡ How many intensive care patients can one nurse covered in PPE (Personal Protective Equipment) take care of?

answer.response: Correct. One nurse will take care of 8 - 10 intensive care patients between eight and nine hours a day or night. The PPE is hot, stuffy and uncomfortable and the nurses suffer a lot.
Wrong. One nurse will take care of 8 - 10 intensive care patients between eight and nine hours a day or night. The PPE is hot, stuffy and uncomfortable and the nurses suffer a lot.
